comments:
Hi, 

When I try to open report created in BIRT v1.0 in BIRT v2.0, then I get the following error :

---
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The extension with ID
'org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.flatfile' is not found!
	at
org.eclipse.birt.report.model.extension.oda.ODAManifestUtil.getDataSourceExtension(ODAManifestUtil.java:51)
	at
org.eclipse.birt.report.model.parser.OdaDataSourceState.parseODADataSourceExtensionID(OdaDataSourceState.java:105)
	at
org.eclipse.birt.report.model.parser.OdaDataSourceState.parseAttrs(OdaDataSourceState.java:55)
...
---

Solve the problem :
Open the "old" report and change the following statements :

1,$s/.birt.report.data.oda.flatfile/.datatools.connectivity.oda.flatfile/g
1,$s/.birt.report.data.oda.flatfile.dataSet/.datatools.connectivity.oda.flatfile.dataSet/g

and You have to replace the following line :

<report xmlns=" http://www.eclipse.org/birt/2005/design" version="2">

by :

<report xmlns="http://www.eclipse.org/birt/2005/design" version="3" id="1">


thanks 
armad

Are we using the plugin full name as the ID for an ODA driver. So when a ODA driver changes its folder name.  report design that is created before the move will be broken.  Shall we consider a way to identify an ODA driver that is not rely on the plugin name of the ODA driver? How about using flatfile as the ODA driver ID instead of the full path?  

Armad,

do you have to replace the following line :
<report xmlns=" http://www.eclipse.org/birt/2005/design" version="2">
by :
<report xmlns="http://www.eclipse.org/birt/2005/design" version="3" id="1">

If so that is another bug.

Thanks

This bug is duplicated with 118574. The reason caused this bug is ODA did some changes from BIRT oda.flatfile to DTP oda.flatfile. We load the oda properties from ODAManifest automatically.As we had the discussion before with Linda, if the community still consider this is an bug, reopen the 118574.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 118574 ***
